means: （一组事物可能的一种）序列，排列，排列中的任一组数字或文字

sentence.Network_en: Every sort of permutation and combination is possible in human nature.
sentence.Network_cn: 火的本性可能有各种交织和组合的情况.

sentence.Network_en: Such a permutation is called a derangement.
sentence.Network_cn: 这样的一个排列称为错位排列.

sentence.Network_en: Other enumeration problems lead us to the study of orbits of permutation groups.
sentence.Network_cn: 其它的计数问题引导我们去研究置换群的轨道.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'exchange, barter'): via Old French from Latin permutatio(n-), from the verb permutare 'change completely' (see permute)

entry.def: A permutation is one of the ways in which a number of things can be ordered or arranged.

example.ex: Variation among humans is limited to the possible permutations of our genes.
example.tran: 人类的变异受限于我们的基因可能存在哪些排列。

means.word_mean: 1. an event in which one thing is substituted for another;

sentences.sentence: "the replacement of lost blood by a transfusion of donor blood"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of changing the arrangement of a given number of elements
3. complete change in character or condition;

sentences.sentence: "the permutations...taking place in the physical world"- Henry Miller

means.word_mean: 4. act of changing the lineal order of objects in a group

auth_sentence.content: Each such arrangement is a permutation of the symbols.

auth_sentence.content: Basic exercises...have been put together in ways susceptible of infinite permutation.

auth_sentence.content: Stones' camp approached yet another permutation of their greatest hits.

stems_affixes.word_buile: commute[v.乘公交车上下班,乘车[船等]往返于两地;交换]+able能……的→可变换的,可交换的
mutiny[n.兵变;反抗 v.叛变]+ous……的→mutinous反抗的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 相互的,彼此的;共同的,共有的
stems_affixes.word_buile: mut改变+ual……的→你变我也变→相互的
mutabil=mutable[adj.易变的,性情不定的]+ity表名词→n.易变性,性情不定
mut改变+iny→n.兵变;反抗 v.叛变
permute[v.序列改变]+ation表名词→n.[数学中]排列变化,彻底改变
